head.title: World Briefing | Europe: France: Furniture Sale To Help Mitterrand's Son

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: France: Furniture Sale To Help Mitterrand's Son

abstract.p: Danielle Mitterrand, widow of former French Pres Francois Mitterrand, sells nine pieces of furniture at auction, raising over $100,000; says she needs money to support couple's son, Jean-Christophe, who faces several criminal probes (S)

block.p: Danielle Mitterrand, the widow of President François Mitterrand, sold nine pieces of furniture at auction belonging to the couple, including items by Le Corbusier, Mies van der Rohe and Charles and Ray Eames. The auction brought more than $100,000, much of which Mrs. Mitterrand said she needed to support the couple's son Jean-Christophe, 57, who faces several criminal investigations, including suspicion of being involved in an illegal arms sale to Angola.
